findings.title: Optimization, `uint256max` could be made constant
findings.description: The variable `uint256max` can be declared as a constant to improve code efficiency.

findings.title: Optimization, `networkClass` could be made constant
findings.description: The variable `networkClass` can be declared as a constant to optimize gas usage and improve code efficiency.

findings.title: Optimization `minNominatedGuardians` could be made constant
findings.description: The variable `minNominatedGuardians` can be declared as a constant to improve code efficiency.

findings.title: Duplicate Entries in Constructor Function
findings.description: The constructor function may initialize the guardians list with duplicate entries.

findings.title: Initialization of `estimatedBlockTime` with Disallowed Value
findings.description: The `constructor()` function initializes `estimatedBlockTime` with 0, which is less than the allowed value by the `setEstimatedBlockTime()` function.

findings.title: Initialization of ConfirmationsToFinality with Disallowed Values
findings.description: The constructor function can initialize confirmationsToFinality with 0 or 1 value, which is less than allowed by the setConfirmationsToFinality function.

findings.title: Optimization
findings.description: The `redeem()` function reads `redeemsInfo[nonce]` value from storage multiple times.

findings.title: Low-Level Address.Call() Usage in redeem() Function
findings.description: The redeem() function uses a low-level address.call() instead of an interface to do minting.

findings.title: Low-Level `address.call()` Usage in Unwrap Function
findings.description: The `unwrap()` function uses a low-level `address.call()` instead of an interface to do burning.

findings.title: Unbounded Nomination of Guardians
findings.description: The nominateGuardians() function lacks an upper limit on the number of new guardians, potentially leading to unexpected behavior and excessive gas consumption.

findings.title: Optimization: Multiple Storage Reads
findings.description: The `proposeAdministrator()` function reads `guardiansVotes[i]` value from storage multiple times, which can be optimized by using a local variable `newAdministrator` instead.

findings.title: Optimization: Unnecessary Storage Reads
findings.description: The `proposeAdministrator()` function reads the administrator value from storage twice, which can be optimized by using a local variable.

findings.title: Emit Event for Easier Accounting
findings.description: The set* functions could emit an event to facilitate easier accounting.

findings.title: Optimization: Unnecessary Storage Reads
findings.description: The `halt()` function reads the `actionsNonce` value from storage twice, resulting in unnecessary gas consumption and potential performance issues.

findings.title: Optimization
findings.description: The `setTss()` function reads the `actionsNonce` value from storage twice.
